Christ Reproved Their Vanity.--He . . . reproved the vanity shown in coveting the title of rabbi, or master. Such a title, He declared, belonged not to 
                                                                           133
men, but to Christ. Priests, scribes, and rulers, expounders and administrators of the law, were all brethren, children of one Father. Jesus impressed upon the people that they were to give no man a title of honor indicating his control of their conscience or their faith.
